description.narrative: By 2019, national and local actors have the capacity to develop child-sensitive budgets and to mobilize resources for the social sectors., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children (Covid), Private Sector Engagement, Private Sector Engagement (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children and vulnerable people have access to sustainable social protection programmes and are benefitting from increasedbudget allocations in the social sectors.

sector.narrative: Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)

Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)
PF4C - domestic revenue mobilization and access to finance for key social services

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2019, national and local actors have the capacity to develop child-sensitive budgets and to mobilize resources for the social sectors.

description.narrative: In its effort to improve domestic financing for child rights, UNICEF undertook key initiatives: 1) conducting a fiscal space study; 2) drawing up an action plan for resource mobilization at local level; and 3) setting up a partnership with ANAFIC. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Local government (incl. municipalities) that mobilize local revenue for child specific programmes
Evidence generated on budgets and their linkages to child outcomes to improve budget allocations/expenditure for children
Convening, technical support and partnerships for financing of social services
Evidence on socio-economic impact of COVID-19 in Guinea is available
Strengthened capacity of stakeholders in budgeting at all levels of government to improve spending outcomes for children
